data.headline-text: Global concern over Russian troop buildup
data.copy-text: Over the course of several months Russia puts more than 100,000 troops on the Ukrainian border. Western intelligence agenices sound the alarm, though Vladimir Putin insists Russia has no plans to invade.
Ukraine and the west's worst fears are realised, as airstrikes hit targets across the country, as far west as Lviv.
Russian forces invade Ukraine from multiple entry points: Belarus to the north, Russia to the east, and  Russia-occupied Crimea to the south.
Russian forces move on several points on the first day of the invasion. Several key locations, including the Chernobyl exclusion zone, were captured by the Russian army.

data.headline-text: Kyiv under threat on second day ...
data.copy-text: Russian troops enter parts of the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, where they face strong resistance, though they are able claim land to the west.

Elsewhere, fighting continues even as Russian progress slows. Russian forces move to encircle the southern circle of Mariupol, although they enjoy less success in the north, where they abandon an attempt to take Chernihiv after heavy fighting.

data.headline-text: Limited progress over weekend - with some advances on cities
data.copy-text: Russian forces advance on key cities including Kharkiv in the north-east, Kyiv in the north and Mariupol in the south. A large convoy of military vehicles approaches the capital, although progress is limited and logistical problems are reported.

data.headline-text: Russia steps up bombardment while Ukrainian forces resist
data.copy-text: As the war enters its second week, Russia steps up shelling of civilian areas. Operations to envelop Kyiv remain the focus of Russia’s efforts, but the ISW reports three other aims: seizing Kharkiv, taking Mariupol and securing a “land bridge” in the south, and securing Kherson in order to set conditions for a drive west towards Mykolayiv and Odesa.

data.headline-text: Russian artillery hit civilian targets as ground forces regroup ...
data.copy-text: Little progress is made over the first two weeks of March. Among reports of lost momentum and low morale, Russian forces were consolidating positions with reinforcements and probing defences around Kyiv. Dozens of civilians were reportedly killed as Russian forces hit cities with artillery and airstrikes, widely seen as a new tactic in the face of limited advances on the ground.

data.headline-text: ... while building "land bridge" and breaking ceasefires in south
data.copy-text: Russia is widely seen as making its best advances in the south, where Kherson became the first major city to fall under Russian control. On the other southern front, several buildings in Mariupol were flattened while people were left without water or power. Russia broke ceasefires for evacuations from Mariupol and Volnovakha.

data.headline-text: Russia tightens grip with reinforcements, especially in south ...
data.copy-text: As the conflict concludes its third week, Russia sends in reinforcements to tighten its grip on the key cities of Kyiv, Kharkiv and Mariupol, which remain under Ukrainian control. Russian advances in the south contrast with difficulties its forces have faced in the north and north-east.

data.headline-text: ... with the war now edging closer to Kyiv
data.copy-text: Nowhere is this resistance stronger than in the increasingly-fortified capital, Kyiv. Russia steps up its artillery and airstrikes on the city in an apparent attempt to degrade defending forces' capacity and morale. It is a strategy that has so far failed in other cities like Sumy, Kharkiv and Mariupol.

data.caption: Multiple targets hit in Kyiv. Residential area hit and six civilians killed in one airstrike in Brovary suburb

Airstrike reported on Ukrainian forces stationed at Blyznyuki

Military vehicles invade from Russian-annexed Crimea toward Kherson
Military vehicles invade from Russian-annexed Crimea toward Melitopol
One of two invasions of Russian troops from Belarus at Senkivka
One of two invasions of Russian troops from Belarus down west side of Dnipro River
Troops invade from Russia and advance on Kharkiv
Troops invade from Russia and advance on Sumy
Russian or Russian-backed forces cross the line of control toward Shchastya
Russian troops move into separatist-controlled areas in Luhansk
Russian troops move into separatist-controlled areas in Donbas
Fighting around Shchastya reported
Two columns of Russian forces advance on Chernihiv
Russian forces secure Chernobyl Exclusion Zone
Fierce fighting around Hostomel military airbase. Ukrainian officials say airport was recaptured by Kyiv forces
Heavy fighting on key roads leading from Russia to Kharkiv
Russian forces advance from Crimea on Kherson city
Ukrainian naval base at Ochakiv attacked
At least 18 dead in missile attack in Odesa region, authorities say
Russian forces from Crimea head to Melitopol, penetrating about 60km into Ukraine
Every soldier defending Zmiinyi Island reportedly killed. This is later called into question with reports they were taken captive
Russian forces advancing on Kyiv from both sides of the Dnipro River
Ukrainian air defences claim to have shot down one Russian Il-76 transport with a "landing force" near Vasylkiv
A second Il-76 is reported to have been shot down over Bila Tserkva
Bridges are destroyed by Ukrainian forces on city border
Russian forces enter north-western Obolonskyi suburb of Kyiv
Russian sabotage groups in civilian clothing reportedly move into downtown Kyiv. Gunfire heard close to St Sophia’s cathedral
Hostomel airport and surrounding area claimed by Russian forces
Irpin bridge, west of Kyiv, destroyed by Ukrainian forces
Heavy fighting with people killed at entrance to Chernihiv. Russians abandon attempt to take city and instead bypass it
Heavy fighting with people killed at entrance to Melitopol. Russian forces later reportedly seize city
Russian forces in control of the city of Sumy
Kharkiv gradually being surrounded by Russian forces
Russian forces claim to have fully captured Kherson
Russian forces achieve little success through frontal assaults or envelopments against Ukrainian forces in Donbas
Fighting continuing around Mariupol, close to line of control with Russian-controlled separatist territories
Russian forces engage in mechanised drives to the capital along a narrow front along the west bank of the Dnipro River
Bridge at Stoyanka, just outside Kyiv, is destroyed. One person killed and four injured.
Russian forces destroy a concrete dam built in Kherson region in 2014 to cut off water to Crimea
No major Russian advances in east. Russian movements reported to be focused on pinning down Ukrainian conventional forces on the former line of contact
Russian forces take Berdyansk from the west
Ukrainian forces reportedly retake Kherson
Kamaryn Slavutych border crossing between Belarus and Ukraine reportedly destroyed by Ukrainian forces
By surrounding Mariupol, Russia aims to establish land bridge between the Donbas and Crimea
Mykolaiv threatened by unknown concentration of Russian forces on the eastern bank of the Dnipro
Nine-storey residential building in Bucha is hit by a Russian strike
Russia deploys additional heavy forces and artillery to employ in assaults on Kyiv's western approach
Desna River bridge, in Chernihiv Oblast, reportedly destroyed by Ukrainian forces
Russian forces target Ukrainian airfields and logistics centres, particularly in western Ukraine
Russian shelling of civilian areas in eastern Ukraine
data.source/ notes: So specific areas known to mark points to

data.caption: After operational pause, Russian forces begin using heavy artillery against central Kharkiv. A cruise missile hits the city's main square.
data.source/ notes: So specific areas known to mark points to

data.caption: Russian and proxy forces resume assaults on Ukrainian forces defending Mariupol from the east, with additional artillery and anti-tank guided missile deployed
Kyiv TV tower and other locations in the capital are shelled. Five people reportedly killed in TV tower attack
An opera house, concert hall and government offices are hit by missiles and rockets in Kharkiv's Freedom Square. At least seven people are killed
Russian forces resume offensive operations against Kyiv’s western outskirts after pausing for resupply
Russian forces launch offensive operations in Zhytomyr Oblast, expanding envelopment of Kyiv further west
Russian forces assault central Kharkiv and continue heavy bombardment of city. Despite bombardment, Russian forces remain relatively static
Shops and a school hit by Russian military strikes in Saltivka, Kharkiv
Russian forces encircle city and conduct campaign to destroy critical civilian infrastructure. City left without water, heating, power or supply and evacuation routes
Russians seize Kherson, then continue to reduce pockets of Ukrainian resistance. This is the first major city Russian forces have captured
Apartment buildings in Irpin destroyed by Russian forces
Front of Russia's huge military convoy, reportedly 40 miles long, located at Antonov airport. UK defence ministry claims it has hardly moved in three days
Authorities in Odesa say the port city preparing for an expected naval attack
Ukrainian forces retreat to Mykolaiv
Ukrainian forces reportedly push back through to Ivankiv after successful counteroffensive operation to take Makariv
At least a platoon’s worth of Russian airborne BMD vehicles destroyed
Russian-backed Donetsk forces in the south reach Novokrasnivka
Russian forces open a new line of advance from Belarus south toward Zhytomyr Oblast, west of Kyiv
Russian forces remain unable to secure Chernihiv. Up to 22 people killed in airstrikes, with a missile reportedly hitting a hospital
Ukrainian forces push Russian units out of Makiriv
Russian forces renew advance on Mykolaiv. Ukrainian military reportedly defeat attempted Russian air assault to take an airfield near Mykolaiv
Russian forces advance on eastern outskirts of Kyiv, probably from the Sumy axis
Russian troops around Kharkiv divert forces to the west and south-east, reportedly to attack areas in Kyiv and Donbas respectively. The city itself remains under bombardment
Russian forces capture Trostianets
Russian forces east of Kharkiv and in northern Luhansk Oblast reportedly trying to link up
Ukrainian forces push Russian units out of Antonov airport
Russian forces enter previously lost Irpin and Bucha after heavy shelling of area. Reports of damage to civilian infrastructure and many civilian deaths. Fighting continues in Irpin for a week
Borodyanka reportedly captured by Russian forces
Reports of Fastiv being fought over
Key communication centres bombed in Zhytomyr
Key communication centres bombed in Bila Tserkva
Ukrainian air force attacks Russian forces in Peremoha
Russian forces establish a forward helicopter base near Ivankiv. On 8 March, Russian forces begin offensive operations against the town
Attack against Russian weapons depot in Nova Basan. Depot probably supported Russian operations closer to Kyiv, on an axis from Brovary to Boryspil airport
Multiple missile strike destroys Vinnytsia airport, where displaced people had fled in search of safety
Reports of Russian multiple-launch rocket system firing on Kyiv from near Brovary
Russian elements under command of Chechen leader Ramazan Kadyrov shelling civilian targets in Myla
22 people including three children reportedly killed as Russian airstrkes, and artillery attacks continue. Civilians start leaving in cars after 12-hour humanitarian corridor deal agreed
Russian forces launch attack near Rakivka, but were reportedly repulsed by Ukrainian defenders
Two Russian battalion tactical groups advance on Byshiv
Ukrainian forces stop offensive on Glukhiv, Sumy Oblast
Ukrainian defenders reportedly repel an unsupported Russian air assault against Vovchansky

Russian forces repeatedly try to take Izym but are reportedly repelled. Shelling continued on 9 March, amid attempts to evacuate civilians. Parts of the town are captured on 12 March, but suffered counteroffensive on 14 March
Chuhuiv reportedly recaptured by Ukrainians
Russian and proxy forces continue to move forward in Donbas region, with operations being conducted north of the Ukraine-controlled city of Severodonetsk with the goal of encircling the city
Four Russian battalion tactical group advance to Yasnohorodka
Ukrainian forces repel Russian attacks on Brovary and damage a Russian armored column
Fighting reported along the Russian line of communication from near Sumy to Nizhyn and even further north toward Hlukhiv
Russian forces continue efforts to take Chernihiv as well as to bypass it to the east
Russian forces again unsuccessfully attack Okhtyrka. Artillery attacks destroy many buildings in the city
Ukrainian forces repulsed Russian attacks on Vyshhorod and Moshchun
Russian forces continue to unsuccessfully attack Severdonetsk
Ukraine claims to have captured or destroyed at least eight Russian tanks and a Tor air defense system
Russian forces attack toward Zazymya and Vyshenky
Russian ballistic missiles strike Yavoriv military training centre, killing at least 35 Ukrainian personnel
Russian forces claim to have captured eastern and southern outskirts of Severodonetsk
Russian-backed Luhansk People's Republic forces capture Popasna
Russian forces conduct missile strikes on an air base in Lutsk
Russian forces conduct missile strikes on an air base in Ivano-Frankivsk
Residential areas in Dnipro hit by Russian missile strikes
Kherson became the first major city to fall under Russian control on 2 March
Russia takes control Europe's largest nuclear power plant. A fire is extinguished after Russian shelling, but all critical systems are reportedly intact
Russian forces renew ground advance on Mykolaiv, having secured Kherson
Russian naval infantry reportedly poised to conduct amphibious landings near Odesa
Russian troops continue to encircle, bomb and shell Mariupol, with the aim being to either destroy it or compel its surrender
Russia violates ceasefire agreement over weekend, collapsing efforts to evacuate civilians from Mariupol. A further 12-hour ceasefire deal is made amid reports of appalling conditions
Russia violates ceasefire agreement over weekend, collapsing efforts to evacuate civilians from Volnovakha
Russian forces make progress towards Zaporizhya. Small force unlikely to be able to take city and predicted to set conditions for operations once reinforcements arrive
Russian troops are conducting intense shelling of Mykolaiv and nearby towns, probably to prepare for a ground assault on the city.
Ukrainian naval infantry claim to conduct a raid that destroyed 30 Russian helicopters
Russian forces unsuccessfully attempt operations towards Ternivka but were driven back to areas near Kapustyne, Balovne, and Novomatviyivske
Three people including a child killed in a strike on a maternity and children's hospital
Russian forces shell Hryhorivka while other forces prepare to move towards the village
Ukrainian commander claims Russian forces are abandoning many vehicles near city and are demoralized due to low temperatures and supply difficulties
Russian forces conduct a new advance northeast from Kherson along the western bank of the Dnipro on March 12, deploying artillery and air defense assets to Mylove
Russian-backed Donetsk People's Republic forces enter Zelenyi Hai. Some forces pushed towards the Donetsk border to Pavlivka, Novomaiors’ke, Novodonets’ke and Novomaiors’ke
Russian forces strike the Zorya-Mashproekt factory. It usually produces engines for naval vessels
Russian forces reportedly shell Popasnaya with prohibited incendiary rockets
Russian forces capture Staromlynivka alongside Yevhenivka, Pavlivka, and Yegorivka
Russia makes significant advances on Krivyi Rih
Russia claim full control of Kherson Oblast, although Ukrainian attacks in the region contest this claim
Ukrainian forces conduct artillery strike on Kherson Airbase, destroying several helicopters and ground vehicles

Ukrainian forces repel Russian forces around Izyum overnight on 13 March, while also repelling attacks near Topolske, Shpakivka, and Donetske. Humanitarian issues are reported, with no electricity, water, or heating
Ukrainian forces conduct counteroffensive which reportedly pushed Russian units to Shpakivka, Donetske and Topolske
Russian forces still assaulting Mariupol from the east and west, while Russian artillery continue to shell the city and its northern outskirts
Russian and Luhansk People's Republic forces continue to launch unsuccessful attacks on Severodonetsk
Russian forces conduct several unsuccessful attacks around Horlivka
Russian forces enter Solodke
City remains under threat but Russian forces have not conducted any major operations in recent days
City remains under threat but Russian forces have not conducted any major operations in recent days
14 Russian vessels operating off the coast of Odesa
Russian forces reportedly still attempting to surround and attack Sumy
Limited fighting reported in Bohdanivka, Lukashi, and Slavutych
Russian forces attack Hulyaipole, Orihiv, and Kamyanske, resuming operations toward Zaporizhya
Russian forces strike Antonov aircraft plant, claiming it was linked to Ukrainian defence industry
Russian artillery hits two residential buildings of nine and 16 floors in the Sviatoshynskyi district
Russian artillery hits a 10-storey residential building in Podilskyi district
Russian artillery hits a house in the Darnytskyi district
Russian artillery hits part of the Lukyanivska metro station. The subway line is still working
Russian forces unsuccessfully attempt to bridge the Irpin River
Russian forces launch several unsuccessful assaults against Irpin and Bucha
Ukrainian forces repulsed Russian attack on Guta-Mezhyhirska, a day after Russia falsely claimed its paratroopers had captured the town
Ukrainian forces repulsed Russian attack on Lyutyszh
Ukrainian forces repulsed Russian attack on Makariv
